questions.text: What was the maiden name of Lucy Ricardo on TV's 'I Love Lucy' ?
questions.explanation:
McGillicuddy.

	The show won over 200 awards, including five Emmys.

questions.text: What was the name of the inventor of the vacuum cleaner ?
questions.explanation:
Ives McGaffey.

	It was invented in 1869, and he called it 'the whirlwind'.

questions.text: This action movie starred John Wayne as a Firebird-driving cop, out to get the gangster who murdered his partner?
questions.explanation:
'McQ'.

	'McQ' was made in 1974, all the other choices are real movies too.

questions.text: Mike McGear was the stage name of the younger brother of what famous rock singer?
questions.explanation:
Paul McCartney.

	His real name was Peter Michael McCartney, but he changed his name soon after the Beatles became famous.

questions.text: What was the name of the advertising agency that employed Darrin Stephens on the 1960's hit tv show 'Bewitched' ?
questions.explanation:
McMann and Tate.

	Both Dick York and Dick Sargent played the role of Darrin Stephens.

questions.text: Spuds McKenzie was the dog featured on what beer's commercials ?
questions.explanation:
Bud Light.

	The bull terrier starred in many Bud Light spots in the 1980s.

questions.text: Joe McVicker was the inventor of a children's toy in 1956, what was it ?
questions.explanation:
Play-Doh.

	Surprisingly enough, it was originally introduced as wallpaper cleaner.

questions.text: This Wisconsin Senator was best known for his investigations of alleged communist activities, who was he ?
questions.explanation:
Joe McCarthy.

	The others were political leaders too. Eugene McCarthy was senator of Minnesota, Thomas McCall, was governor of Oregon and William McAdoo, was a senator from California.

questions.text: Cartoon dog, 'McGruff', was created by the Advertising Council to promote what ?
questions.explanation:
Crime prevention.

	His catch phrase was 'Take a bite out of crime'.

questions.text: Jack Nicholson won the Best Actor Award for the role of Randle Patrick McMurphy in what film?
questions.explanation:
'One Flew Over The Cuckoo's Nest'.

	Ken Kesey's story was turned into a film and released in 1975.
